sources.title: Strike
sources.description:
Sergei Eisenstein's "Strike" is the first historical-revolutionary film. It featured actors from the First Workers' Theater.

For the centenary of the famous film, Mosfilm specialists optimized the image and soundâ€”"Strike" is now available for viewing in enhanced quality!

A strike is organized at one of Russia's largest factories, triggered by the suicide of a worker unjustly accused by the factory administration of stealing tools...

Year of production: 1925

IMDb: 7.6

Director: Sergei Eisenstein
Screenwriters: Sergei Eisenstein, Grigory Aleksandrov, Ilya Kravchunovsky, Valerian Pletnev
Cinematography: Eduard Tisse, Vasily Khvatov
Production Designer: Vasily Rakhals

Cast: Maxim Straukh, Alexander Antonov, Grigory Aleksandrov, Mikhail Gomorov, Igor Ivanov, Ivan Klyukvin, Vladimir Uralsky (Popov), Judith Glizer, Pavel Poltoratsky, Boris Yurtsev, Vera Yanukova

- Gold Medal for Sergei Eisenstein at the International Exhibition of Decorative Arts in Paris (France) (1925)

00:00:00 Start
00:00:45 Title and Credits
00:01:45 Chapter One
00:16:14 Chapter Two
00:33:45 Chapter Three
00:41:27 Chapter Four

sources.title: Strike
sources.description: Strike was directed in 1925 by Sergai Eisenstein. It was Esienstein's first feature film and an indicator of the brilliant films t follow. As with other Communist films of this period, the workers in general are the heroes. The composition and editing are spectacular, particularly with the scenes as the troop raid the apartment buildings, and the conclusion where the killing of the workers is intercut with the slaughter of cattle.

metadata.Plot: In Russia's factory region during Czarist rule, there's restlessness and strike planning among workers; management brings in spies and external agents. When a worker hangs himself after being falsely accused of thievery, the workers strike. At first, there's excitement in workers' households and in public places as they develop their demands communally. Then, as the strike drags on and management rejects demands, hunger mounts, as does domestic and civic distress. Provocateurs recruited from the lumpen and in league with the police and the fire department bring problems to the workers; the spies do their dirty work; and, the military arrives to liquidate strikers.
metadata.Writer: Grigoriy Aleksandrov, Sergei Eisenstein, Ilya Kravchunovsky
metadata.Actors: Grigoriy Aleksandrov, Maksim Shtraukh, Mikhail Gomorov
